g.text: Preparation of soybean nuclear extracts and electrophoretic
Nuclear protein extracts were prepared as described (22)
from soybean suspension culture cells (W82). Aliquots
were taken for determining protein concentrations
with the Bradford protein assay kit (Bio-Rad), and
aliquots of the extracts were frozen in tubes at
EMSA was performed as described (13,23) using
P]-labeled DNA probes. Soybean nuclear extracts or
GST fusion proteins were pre-incubated in a binding
buﬀer (20 mM HEPES, pH 7.9, 0.5 mM DTT,
glycerol) for 10 min at room temperature and then
incubated with 40 Kcpm of end-labeled probes for
20 min. The resulting protein–DNA complexes were
gels in 0.5 X TBE buﬀer. The gels were dried and
The DNase I footprinting assay was performed as
described (24,25) using a 118 bp DNA fragment contain-
SphI and SpeI sites. The fragment was labeled with
isotope at the SpeI site. A DNA-nuclear protein binding
60 mM KCl, 1 mM EDTA pH 8.0, 7% glycerol and
1 mM DTT was pre-incubated for 20 min at room
temperature, one unit of DNase I cofactor solution
l) was added, and incubation was continued for
3 min at room temperature. Stop solution (100
g of proteinase K was immediately added and
incubation was continued for 30 min at 55
reaction mixtures were extracted with Tris-saturated
phenol, and products were precipitated by adding
l 3 M sodium acetate, pH 5.2, and 500
ethanol. The ﬁnal pellet was re-suspended in sequenc-
0.1% bromophenol blue, 0.1% xylene cyanol), and the
ice, and loaded onto 8% polyacrylamide-urea DNA
clones were cloned into the BamHI and XhoI sites of
Pharmacia Biotech), respectively. The resulting constructs
were conﬁrmed by sequencing and introduced into
BL21 (pLys S) DE3, and GST fusion proteins were
expressed and puriﬁed using glutathione–agarose beads
Various tissues harvested from 4-day etiolated soybean
L. cv. Williams) seedlings and W82 cells
collected on ﬁlter papers by vacuum ﬁltration were used
for isolation of total RNA. RNA gel blot analysis was
carried out as previously described (26). Total RNA
g each sample) prepared from apical hypocotyls,
seed, root and pathogen-treated soybean suspension cells
gels, transferred onto a nylon membrane (Hybond
cDNA probe. To verify equal loading, rRNA was
visualized by staining with ethidium bromide.
Hybridization and washing were performed under high
A GmZF-HD1 antibody was raised against the
Facility, Gyeongsang National University). A protein
A-Sepharose column was used to separate the IgG
fraction of the rabbit serum. After adjusting the pH of
the crude serum to 8.0 by adding 1/10 volume of 1.0 mM
Tris–HCl (pH 8.0), the antibody solution was washed
extensively with 10 column vol of 100 mM Tris–HCl
The antibody was eluted with 0.1 M glycine–HCl
(pH 2.5) and immediately neutralized with 0.1 vol of 1 M
Tris–HCl (pH 8.0). The supershift assay was performed by
antibody and nuclear extracts together, and the samples
were then processed as for EMSA. Control experiments
were performed by incubating the same amount of IgG
fraction of preimmune antiserum in the binding reaction

inserted into a plant expression vector (
performed as previously described (29). In each transfor-
g of the eﬀector construct or a vector
incubated in W5 solution for 16 h in the dark.
trically with the substrate 4-methyl umbelliferyl glucu-
ronide, as described (27). LUC assays were performed
using the Promega luciferase assay systemaccording to the
manufacturer’s instructions. To normalize the transfection
